Html:
Hi,

I know that .NET has issues loading 32-bit DLLs from a 64-bit process.  My application is built for 64-bit processors, however it can't load the GMap.NET assembly because it's 32-bit.  Any chance you could do a a 64-bit build of the library?  :)

 

Otherwise I have to change my app to a 32-bit build.  (or if anyone knows a workaround for this, please let me know).

 

The Exception is BadImageFormatException. ... seen it before with a similar situation.

thanks,

Jon
hey, just build project using x64 sqlite reference, it is included in svn

Thanks for the quick response.

Any idea how to use this control, there is no documentation?

Just want to add a few markers on a map for several addresses.  Should I use GMap.Overlays.Add(…)?
